questions.question: Samuel said that he …………………………. to his friend’s house.
questions.description: When the reporting verb is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the reported speech as well.

questions.question: Molly said that she ……………………………. to go.
questions.description: When the reporting verb is in the past tense, we use a past tense in the reported speech as well.

questions.question: Swapna says that she ………………………… the exam.
questions.description: When the reporting verb is in the present tense, we can use a present tense in the reported speech as well.

questions.question: Asok said that his father …………………………. in Bangalore.
Bindu said that she …………………………… to Jaipur.
Susie said that she ……………………………… a car.
questions.description: A past tense in the direct speech changes to past perfect in the indirect speech.

questions.question: Father asked me where ……………………………. going.
questions.description: In indirect questions the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: My friend requested me …………………………… him to the library.
questions.description: Imperatives are reported with a to-infinitive.

questions.question: She asked me where the bank ……………………………
I don’t know what …………………………. doing there.
questions.description: In reported questions, the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: The doctor suggested ………………………….. a long holiday.
questions.description: Suggest cannot be followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: She asked me ………………………… I was alright.
questions.description: To introduce yes/no questions we use if or whether.
